title: Air Canada partners with Canadian chef David Hawksworth on new menu [Photos]
text:
By Nicole Feenstra , Postmedia Network First posted: Wednesday, September 09, 2015 10:22 AM MDT Air Canada partners with Canadian chef David Hawksworth on new menu 
Tamari Roasted Sablefish. (Courtesy Air Canada) 
BBQ Chicken. (Courtesy Air Canada) 
Yellowfin Tuna Tataki. (Courtesy Air Canada) 
Smoked Ontario Duck Breast. (Courtesy Air Canada) Airports, Airlines & Security 
Canadian chef David Hawksworth, of top Vancouver eatery Hawksworth Restaurant , has partnered with Air Canada to develop a new menu for passengers flying in international business class or relaxing in the Maple Leaf Lounge. 
The food crafted by Hawksworth will feature seasonal appetizers, mains and desserts inspired by international routes, including Tamari roasted sablefish, yellowfin tuna tataki and Mediterranean quinoa salad. 
"My team and I are relishing the unique challenge of developing dishes that can be enjoyed at 35,000 feet," Hawksworth said in a statement. "It's an honour and a pleasure to be invited by Air Canada to share my concept of Canadian cuisine and to create compelling dishes for their passengers that will showcase the very best of our region." Excited to announce my culinary partnership with our country's national airline @AirCanada tonight. #AirCanadaChef pic.twitter.com/KKLoPDFsX2 — David Hawksworth (@ChefHawksworth) September 3, 2015 
The chef created a total of nine dishes for Air Canada, which will be available on flights beginning Oct. 1. 
"I look forward to giving passengers a small taste of my restaurant here in Vancouver and taking my personal culinary philosophy to new heights with Air Canada," Hawksworth said. Reader's comments »
